title: Can't borrow a variable that should be borrowable

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-confusing
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error that should be reworked

body:
I have a test that is essentially something like
```rust
#[test]
fn test() {
    // ...
    let x = value;
    let result = function(&mut x);
    drop(result);
    let y = x.other_function();
}
```
where `other_function` takes `&self` as argument.

I expected this to compile, because `x` should be free to be borrowed again, it seems to me. I however get the following error `E0502`:
```
error[E0502]: cannot borrow `tableau` as immutable because it is also borrowed as mutable
   --> src/algorithm/simplex/logic.rs:208:19
    |
205 |         let result = primal::<_, _, _, FirstProfitable>(&mut tableau);
    |                                                         ------------ mutable borrow occurs here
...
208 |         let obj = tableau.objective_function_value();
    |                   ^^^^^^^
    |                   |
    |                   immutable borrow occurs here
    |                   mutable borrow later used here
```
Notice the odd error message, indicating an immutable and mutable borrow at the same time.

Unfortunately I was not able to isolate a small reproducing sample. The code can be found [here](https://github.com/vandenheuvel/rust-lp/blob/b8bb058b6094d9324a5902d492a1f3d2b07d3c21/src/algorithm/simplex/logic.rs#L208), running `cargo test` will display the error.

```
rustc 1.46.0-nightly (0262de554 2020-06-07)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 0262de554b4c4c5af346137bbb1664a3f6cf4df2
commit-date: 2020-06-07
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.46.0-nightly
LLVM version: 10.0
```
